When I was rebuilding my workspace this morning I got the following exception:
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.jobs 4 2 2006-07-11 07:30:42.593
!MESSAGE LockManager.handleException
!STACK 0
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
	at java.lang.System.arraycopy(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.DeadlockDetector.resizeGraph(DeadlockDetector.java:630)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.DeadlockDetector.setToWait(DeadlockDetector.java:669)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.DeadlockDetector.lockWaitStart(DeadlockDetector.java:389)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.LockManager.addLockWaitThread(LockManager.java:140)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ThreadJob.waitStart(ThreadJob.java:313)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ThreadJob.joinRun(ThreadJob.java:158)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ImplicitJobs.begin(ImplicitJobs.java:87)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobManager.beginRule(JobManager.java:219)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.utils.StringPoolJob.run(StringPoolJob.java:99)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

this results in a building workspave jobs that cannot be canelled and forces a restart
I don't see what can cause this from the code, but I have added more debugging info so the log will have more details if it happens again.
